Text: Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked with integrity; I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
Context: David proclaims his innocence and steadfast faith in the Lord, asking to be judged according to his righteousness.

Text: Examine me, O LORD, and try me; test my heart and my mind.
Context: David invites the Lord to scrutinize him, an act of transparency and confidence in his devotion.

Text: For Your loving devotion is before my eyes, and I have walked in Your truth.
Context: David acknowledges his commitment to God’s steadfast love and truth, which has guided his actions.

Text: I do not sit with deceitful men, nor do I keep company with hypocrites.
Context: David distances himself from deceitful and hypocritical individuals, emphasizing his commitment to integrity.

Text: I hate the assembly of evildoers, and I refuse to sit with the wicked.
Context: David expresses strong aversion to the gatherings of those who do evil, further highlighting his dedication to righteousness.

Text: I wash my hands in innocence and go around Your altar, O LORD,
Context: David symbolically performs a ritual of cleansing to demonstrate his innocence as he approaches God‘s place of worship.

Text: proclaiming aloud Your praise and telling of all Your wonderful deeds.
Context: David publicly declares his praise for the Lord and shares about the wonders God has performed.

Text: O LORD, I love the house where You dwell, the place where Your glory resides.
Context: David expresses his deep affection for God’s presence and the sanctuary that houses His divine glory.

Text: Do not take my soul away with sinners, nor my life with men of bloodshed,
Context: David pleads with God not to be counted among the wicked or those who commit violence, indicating his desire for moral distinction.

Text: in whose hands are wicked schemes, whose right hands are full of bribes.
Context: David points out the corrupt practices of the wicked, distancing himself from their actions.

Text: But I will walk with integrity; redeem me and be merciful to me.
Context: David reaffirms his commitment to walk in integrity and requests redemption and mercy from the Lord.

Text: My feet stand on level ground; in the great congregation I will bless the LORD.
Context: David expresses confidence in his right standing, indicating that he is prepared to worship and bless the Lord publicly.
